content:
As I mentioned yesterday, I took our excellent discussion's comments and put them in a google doc where we can massage them over the weekend for submission Monday to HL7.

AI and Health Data - comments from Patient Empowerment WG

(For anyone who wasn't on this week's WG meeting, I hope the brief explanation at top is clear enough. In short, ANSI is asking HL7 to comment on the subject (by next Friday), so yesterday our WG collected some initial thoughts. We'll submit them to HL7 Monday, to be woven into the larger HL7 response. )

I took a stab at grouping the remarks into some categories but I'm not at all wedded to it - all comments welcome. Also, if anyone wants to co-manage or totally manage this, I'll love it; this was supposed to be a weekend off for me, but time is short.

The document is set to "anyone with the link can comment." I'm happy to give edit privileges to anyone on request.

Last call for comments! It's shaping up into a pretty robust set of concerns. Our WG will submit to HL7 today.

Dave deBronkart said:

AI and Health Data - comments from Patient Empowerment WG

(For anyone who wasn't on this week's WG meeting, I hope the brief explanation at top is clear enough. In short, ANSI is asking HL7 to comment on the subject (by next Friday), so yesterday our WG collected some initial thoughts. We'll submit them to HL7 Monday, to be woven into the larger HL7 response. )

Thanks to Richard Townley-O'Neill for adding the unique-ID problem to the list of error types.

Terrie Reed said:

Good work!

Sent from my iPhone

It's a good group! Lots of smarts.

The CTA recently released an ANSI accredited set of health care AI definitions that may be helpful. https://shop.cta.tech/collections/standards/products/definitions-characteristics-of-ai-in-health-care
